Posts.Content: Apr 13, 2011 09:08AM EllsJen5 wrote: I didn't think it was even possible to get insurance with StageIV.  Can you provide me with the link and any additional information.  My wife is 34 with Stage IV and she has no life insurance so this would be a big relief to both of us.  We worry about this all the time $10k isn't much but it's better than nothing.  Is it a flat monthly fee?  How hard is it to get approved?

Posts.Content: Jul 7, 2011 02:21PM EllsJen5 wrote: My wife just completed her 2nd cycle on Friday.  Much like you, she has had very little side effects, in fact, she made the comment to me last night that the last few weeks she has felt better than she has for the last year.  We are still at least a cycle away from a scan so were in the same boat as you, hoping and praying that it's working.  I know she isn't in any pain anymore so I'm hoping thats a good sign that this stuff is kicking some major butt.
Posts.Title: Halaven - Day 1 PJB Wanderingneedle

Posts.Content: Jul 19, 2011 09:22PM EllsJen5 wrote: My wife just completed her second round of Halaven with very little from a side effect standpoint.  Her tCA27-29 tumor markers have went from 17.7 to a 17.1 after two treatments so, I'm assuming were probably going to stay this course.  As long as the markers aren't rising, I guess were on the right track
Posts.Title: Halaven - Day 1 PJB Wanderingneedle

Posts.Content: EllsJen5 wrote: Ok, very stressful around this house today.  My wife was diagnosed with bone mestatis back in June2010.  She had major surgery on her femur in July to remove a large tumor, followed by chemo, radiation and she is currently on Aromisin.  Her Pet Scan in October came back clean in October 2010, there was some uptake in her surgery area but both doctors informed us that is to be expected for up to two years.  Flash forward to last Friday, her second pet scan, everything is clear except her leg where the surgery took place, it lit up again.  Her oncologist described it as "not really a hot spot" but something they want to do an MRI on.  Last week we met with her surgeon who removed the tumor from her leg, he took an x-ray and everything came back normal, he told us once again that the leg will light up in a pet scan for at least 2 years maybe longer and not to worry about it.  He also asked us to start exercising and strecthing that leg more, so last week prior to the pet scan for several days in the evening we worked on really stretching out her leg.  This latest news has made my wife almost sick, she went to bed, very upset.  My thought is, it could very well be nothing, it could be from the extensive strectching that we did last week to loosen her leg up caused some inflammation which set the Pet scan off.  Has anyone had any experience in this area of causing false positives?  Were worried sick, please, any information that you can share will be very much appreciated. Dx 6/16/2010, DCIS, 1cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, 3/21 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Help Us, Please. EllsJen5 dreamwriter

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2013 08:19AM EllsJen5 wrote: It's a little difficult. Mainly the HFS from xeloda and fatigue from the Taxotere. But all in all not to bad. She has been working full time on this regime despite me not wanting her to but the se's are manageable
Posts.Title: Xeloda and Taxotere combo EllsJen5 stagefree

Posts.Content: EllsJen5 wrote: My wife's Dr. called her today that her tumor markers have fallen into the normal range.  When she first started chemo her CA27-29 markers were at 43.7, last week after three TAXOL treatments her markers are now in the normal range 28.9!!!!  Made my day for sure.  If the tumor markers are falling my assumption is her treatment plan is working, is this a fair assumption? Dx 6/16/2010, DCIS, 1cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, 3/21 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Good News Today EllsJen5 mbk

Posts.Content: EllsJen5 wrote: So after three months of Taxol and Aredia.  My wife had her first Pet Scan after being diagnosed with bone mets in two spots.  One on the sacrum and one on her Femur.  Surgery in July to remove the tumor on her femur.  There is now no evidence of disease!!!  Best news ever but it leads to several questions.  I know there always a chance of the cancer coming back and it's higher since she is considered Stage IV.  Her doctor told us Friday that there's stageIV cancer and then theres stage iv cancer.  Meaning, by textbook standards she's stage IV but due to the limited disease and that it was caught so early she has a better chance for long term survival?  Does that make sense and has anyone else out there had this experience?  She is both estrogen and progetron positive which her Dr. said is another huge thing she has going for her?  Long term she will continue the last of this Taxol cycle and then the plan is to have her on Aredia for another 5 years or so.  She will also begin taking a drug to control her estrogen, not Tamoxifin but another drug, Armedex maybe?  I know her Dr. prior to the scan was expecting good results but she was very surprised and very happy that it was already clean.  Please give me your thoughts.  Continue to pray for all of you!! Dx 6/16/2010, DCIS, 1cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, 3/21 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Good News, the wife is dancing with NED EllsJen5 RobinNY

Posts.Content: EllsJen5 wrote: My wife's Dr called to night to give us the bad news.  Her cancer is back for the 4th time in 3 years.  One spot on her rib and one spot on her L4, I'm devastated.  She is wanting to start her on Halaven.  She thinks this might be the drug that will not this to the curb for a long while.  Does anyone have any experience on Halaven?  I see where hair loss is a common side effect but not in all cases.  Any experience or anything that you can share would be appreciated.  I'm heartbroken.  I can't stand the thought of losing her so young.  Please help me!!! Dx 6/16/2010, DCIS, 1cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, 3/21 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Update-Not What We Wanted EllsJen5 dianaleo

Posts.Content: EllsJen5 wrote: Wanted to see if any of you ladies have done this chemo combo. My wife's pet scan in september of 2012 showed progression in her bones and multiple tumors to her liver. She started this combo in October and just got back scan results this week which showed significant improvement in her bones and the majority of the tumors in her liver are resolved. Which is great news. Putting this out there in the hopes that maybe this combo will work as well for some of you. I haven't really seen much talk of this combo Dx 6/16/2010, DCIS, 1cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, 3/21 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Xeloda and Taxotere combo EllsJen5 stagefree

Posts.Content: EllsJen5 wrote: The wife has a PET/CT scan on Tuesday which happens to be the same day our son graduates high school.  You might remember her story, she was diagnosed Stage IV in June 2010.  Her cancer went in remission in October 2010 and then she had a small spot on her femur in Feb 2011 which they radiated.  This is a huge scan for her, if something pops up her Onc tells us this is a sign that the Aromisin isn't working and she will have to go back on chemo for up to a year.  So this is huge obviously.  Her tumor markers have ranged from 6-15 in the last three months so they are normal.  That being said, I'm scared to death.  Which leads me to several questions that I was hoping you guys could help me with.  Has anyone had low tumor markers had a scan and the scan shows cancer everywhere?  Also, if Aromisin has failed you, what was your next step?  Chemo?  It just seems like her Dr. is being almost overly aggressive.  The last couple months have been great, this is the best she has felt in over three years and I hate the fact that she might have to go back on chemo.  My wife is 34,ER+(95%) PR+(30%) and Her-.  I know we probably have years yet to spend together but the thought of losing her makes me sick. Dx 6/16/2010, DCIS, 1cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, 3/21 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jun 22, 2011 10:28PM EllsJen5 wrote: My wife will be starting her second cycle of Halaven this Friday.  So far, she really hasn't had any side effects outside of stomach cramps every now and then but the first cycle was really easy on her which immediately makes me wonder, is this stuff working?  I hate to hear of others that struggle with side effects and I hate this damn disease.  So far, she hasn't lost any hair, although, I'm not sure when most start to lose thier hair.  From what I understand it's a 50/50 shot.  When did you guys start noticing thiniing etc..? Wishing you all nothing but the best and hope this stuff kicks some major cancer butt!!!!
